page.title: 14Local History, Gwyddelwern 2
page.content: One tavern is now a thriving garage, and with the break up of the large estates, rows of cottages were built in the village itself.In{1880}the local wealthy families renovated the church and built the tower, the spire was added later in memory of a son killed in the War. Since the two World Wars the large landowners have lost their influence over the village and major facilities such as the Village Hall and Sports field are provided by the community. Marched across by{Llewellyn, Glyndwr and{Cromwell,}the village has maintained its independant character and is mainly welsh-speaking. Over the centuries houses have been build, repaired and improved but never abandoned, and it remains a self-supporting independant community. Miss E. Stinson.
